name: Erika Kreisman
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Erika, our Staff is dedicated to providing all our guests with outstanding customer service and quality work you can trust! If there is anything else we can do to assist you, please let us know! Take care!
text:
I recently purchased a 2024 Ford Ranger XLT 4x4, and I couldn’t be happier with both the truck and the experience, thanks to Justin.  From the first interaction, he was professional, patient, and genuinely helpful. He made sure I felt confident with the entire process, answering all my questions without any pressure.

What really stood out was the service after the sale. Justin followed up with me once I got home just to check in and see how the drive went—a thoughtful gesture that meant a lot. On top of that, he helped me set up the FordPass app, even though it wasn’t part of his role. His willingness to go the extra mile shows their dedication to customer satisfaction.

I’m thrilled with my new Ranger—it’s powerful yet stylish. I highly recommend Justin and the entire team for anyone looking for a seamless and enjoyable car-buying experience.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Osvaldo Gutierrez
text: Soy un cliente frecuente y el lunes 24 de marzo llevé mi automóvil al servicio, como de costumbre. Sin embargo, al recogerlo, la aplicación FordPass dejó de funcionar.  Informé el problema al técnico, quien comentó que era extraño. Lo extraño es que, desde entonces, la aplicación indica que mi vehículo está estacionado en el concesionario, a pesar de que lo he estado conduciendo.  He presentado varias quejas, y me han solicitado que lo lleve de nuevo el miércoles 2 de abril, lo cual haré.  No estoy del todo satisfecho con el servicio recibido. Uno confía en dejar su vehículo en un lugar que se supone debe ser confiable, pero, lamentablemente, mis experiencias no han sido positivas. Si bien siempre solucionan los problemas, en ocasiones implica costos adicionales para mí, aunque a veces la garantía cubre los gastos.  Me preocupa que FordPass dejara de funcionar después de la entrega del vehículo y que la aplicación indique que mi automóvil está estacionado en el concesionario.  Esto me genera ciertas dudas.
textTranslated: I am a frequent customer and on Monday March 24th I took my car in for service as usual. However, upon picking it up, the FordPass app stopped working.  I reported the problem to the technician, who commented that it was strange. The strange thing is that since then the app indicates that my vehicle is parked at the dealership, even though I have been driving it.  I have made several complaints, and have been asked to bring it back on Wednesday, April 2, which I will do.  I am not entirely satisfied with the service received. You trust leaving your vehicle in a place that is supposed to be trustworthy, but unfortunately, my experiences have not been positive. While they always fix the problems, it sometimes involves additional costs for me, although sometimes the warranty covers the costs.  I am concerned that FordPass stopped working after delivery of the vehicle and that the app indicates that my car is parked at the dealership.  This raises certain doubts in me.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Dr. Olmos
responseFromOwnerText: Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave us your response to our Staff's outstanding customer service! Please let us know if you have any additional questions about services you received and thank you again for choosing Ford of Montebello!
text:
Miguel Gonzalez is genuinely a standout service advisor whose commitment to customer satisfaction is nothing short of remarkable. With a blend of professionalism, expertise, and a genuine desire to help, Miguel goes above and beyond in every interaction.
His attention to detail is unmatched—he listens carefully to each customer's concerns and addresses them thoroughly. Whether it's a routine repair or a complex issue, Miguel ensures that no stone is left unturned in resolving the problem. He never rushes the job and always takes the time to explain the process to the customer, ensuring they feel informed and at ease.
What truly sets Miguel apart, however, is his friendly and approachable demeanor. His warm attitude makes customers feel valued, respected, and confident that they are in good hands. He doesn't just complete the job; he builds relationships, earning trust with every visit.
Miguel is passionate about providing the best possible service, which is reflected in his exceptional feedback from clients. His dedication to excellence and unwavering commitment to customer satisfaction make him a standout in his field, and it's no surprise that customers continue to rely on him for all their service needs.
Miguel Gonzalez, the service advisor, understands that he plays a crucial role in creating positive and memorable experiences for every customer. He knows excellent customer service is characterized by attentive, friendly, and personalized assistance. He knows it means going above and beyond to meet customer needs and ensure satisfaction. He knows it involves active listening, prompt responses, and a willingness to find solutions to any issues. He believes excellent customer service builds trust and loyalty, leaving customers feeling valued and cared for. I recommend you seek Miguel Gonzalez as a service advisor for any customer needs regarding your vehicle. I will recommend him to all my dearest family members and closest friends. Miguel exceeds expectations in the role of a service adviser. His quality of work and accuracy to customer needs is remarkable. He adapts to change quickly, works well under pressure with a positive attitude, and is detail-oriented. Miguel goes beyond the call of duty by seeking and following up on additional responsibilities and frequently contributes to customer needs. He has exceptional communication and problem-solving skills. I will recommend all my immediate family and dearest friends to seek Miguel for any service needs on your car. Thank you for your hard work and effective and efficient customer satisfaction. Miguel, the service adviser, exceeded customer needs and expectations. He understands that meeting customer expectations may not be enough in a highly competitive service environment. He strives not just to meet but to exceed customer needs and expectations. Nothing impresses a customer more than a service adviser who goes "above and beyond the call of duty" to ensure total customer satisfaction. He understands customers expect something more than traditional customer service. He knows that a customer not only expects but demands exceptional customer service. It was amazing to watch a service adviser exceed his expectations. It showed that he cares personally and works swiftly and effectively on my behalf. The following day, he called about the service on my vehicle. It showed how much he cares about customer satisfaction and maintaining excellent public relations. He understands that follow-up is one of the most effective ways to develop customer loyalty. He invested time and resources in important things that matter to customers. I highly recommend seeking Miguel for any service needs on your vehicle. He truly understands the customer's needs and satisfaction.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Delmi “Alay.” Santos
text: I had been a loyal customer since 2015. I had purchased 3 different vehicles within this time. I finished paying my last car on May 30th 2024 a car that I purchased on 11/12/2020 I had add 10 extra maintenance services because the seller said that will give me a better payment option. When I purchased it the seller told me that even if I finish paying my car my services will remain valid since it was not an insurance it was something extra I add on my loan. Well I took my car in for service on December 24th 2024 and even though I still have 4 remaining services the advisor said my plan has expired. That wasn't a plan that was my extra money I put in for services that I will need for future years. I have been calling over and over, emailing this people and no one wants to help. Ahh but I haven't disclosed that when they were selling me the vehicle they told me that the only way for me to get a better interest rate on my loan was by adding that extra service to my contract. I sure have just left that place but I was a customer already and when you know some business you just trust them. I just want them to complete the services for which I had already paid. I don't understand why they will lie to customers and take the money as nothing happens. If I were to advised someone that is trying to buy from this dealership I will recommend you to stay away from them look for other options in your area. As I spoke to someone in their service department few minutes ago they don't care. The lady that answered said I am busy right now I will transfer you back to the main menu like I am not a customer. Women's treating me like nothing and men at this dealership abusing they power to make customer paid for something that they won't honor. Now few minutes later a manager call me to tell please forgive me but you signed a contract so if you want reach a lawyer because we have your signature on the contract they is nothing we can do. They even have the balls to call me and intimated me instead of finding a solution. No one explains the contract they have a kind of computer screen on the table for you to sing facing their way and they are telling me why didn't you read your contract they don't print a contract until is been signed.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Olivia Zavala
responseFromOwnerText: Hi, we are so disappointed to learn of this situation you have described. We would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you regarding this matter so we can work towards a resolution. Please contact our Service Director, Steven Chen, at (323) 838-6920 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to make this right.
text: I took my vehicle in for service this past Monday.  My vehicle has 45K miles on it.  I was concerned when the paperwork indicated that I was there for the 30K service.  I shared with the service advisor that what if that affects my warranty... He said that ALL the paperwork automatically prints out as 30K service.  I asked for them to re-do the paperwork.  The quote also noted a charge for $120 for "detail vehicle" which I never asked for. Under appointment the "no" box was checked but I did have an appointment.  Then it said that "Customer request four wheel alignment".  I didn't request this but was informed it needed it.  I just like for communications to be clear and correct.  I left with an uneasy feeling.  My vehicle continues to "pull" to the left when making light right maneuvers.  As much as my family has always purchased FORD vehicles it may be time for me to look to other manufacturers.  I'm saddened but must be realistic.
title: Ford of Montebello

text: Bought a car in August 2024, in December 2024 the transmission went out. So I find out there's a recall on 2020 Ford explorers. Then says I should be grateful that they're gonna fix it.  Grateful would've been them not selling the car period knowing it had a recall. They are very rude, have no manners or empathy that now I'm paying for a car after 4 months of purchasing it, just sitting in my driveway cause now they say it won't get repaired til middle of January. They were very aware of the recall cause they did mentioned it while we're arguing back n forth. Let's see if it gets repaired in January..

name: Dylan di Franco
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Dylan, our Staff is dedicated to providing all our guests with outstanding customer service and quality work you can trust! Safe travels!
text:
Just leased a 2024 Mustang Mach E Premium from Ford of Montebello. This was my husband's 1st New Car and 1st Lease and he was extremely hesitant to move forward. I began researching the car at several dealerships about mid August of 2024. To say that I spent a lot of time emailing several dealerships back and forth is a bit of an understatement. Several dealerships did not follow up or were clearly not really reading my questions; they just wanted us to come in to the dealership.

Julio Munoz at Ford of Montebello was incredibly consistent and transparent in answering all of my questions. To be honest, I did not have high expectations for the car. I test drove the Mach E with Julio and was surprised at how much I liked the car. The ride was solid and the car felt powerful. The materials and design were really pretty amazing. I want one for myself!

After test driving the Mach E husband really liked the car as well. We circled back with Julio on my husband's trade-in and worked out a lease agreement. They appear to discount their cars more consistently than other dealerships. I do not pretend to understand how car sales work, and I know they are a business and there to make a profit, but I felt we were treated  fairly. Everyone at Ford of Montebello, from sales support to finance were very friendly, professional and helpful.

Working with Julio made our lease of a 2024 Mach E Premium a very rewarding experience. We have had questions since taking the car home and follow up with Ford of Montebello has been great. Julio never lost patience with us (which speaks to his character) and continued to communicate clearly and we never felt pressured at any point.

I will happily go back to Ford of Montebello if I decide to get a Mach E for myself.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Ang RP
responseFromOwnerText: Angelica, at Ford of Montebello, we value our clients'. We are glad to hear that you were taken care of right away, as well as made you fell valued while you were at our dealership. We look forward to seeing you on your next visit. Take care!

name: Lei Yang
responseFromOwnerText: Lei, we are so disappointed to learn of this situation you have described. We take our customers’ comments seriously so we hope that you’ll reach out to our General Manager, Jonivan Valles at (323) 838-6920 so we can understand exactly what went wrong and do our best to try and resolve this matter to the best of our ability.
text:
It is disappointing that the promises made during the sale don’t seem to matter once the car is sold.

During the purchase, the dealership assured me that only a soft credit pull would be conducted. However, I noticed a significant drop in my FICO credit score—from "Very Good" to "Good"—afterward. This assurance of minimal impact directly influenced my decision to proceed, as I otherwise would have waited a few days until my cashier’s check was ready. This unexpected drop has now affected my plans to purchase a home, yet I am unable to receive any clarification or support despite raising this issue.

The sales manager also agreed to follow up on a concern regarding the car's locking system—a potentially dangerous situation where the car locked automatically with the key, phone, and personal belongings inside. This has never happened with my previous cars, and I was expecting feedback to understand the cause and how to prevent it. Unfortunately, I have received no response, even after considerable time has passed.

These unresolved issues have caused significant frustration and inconvenience, and I hope they can be addressed promptly.
title: Ford of Montebello

So people be aware, these people don't have people skills, they couldn't care less of your situation financially and just take care of your car else where.

name: Stephen Carignan
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Stephen, we appreciate your feedback! If you have any additional needs or questions, we will be more than happy to assist you! Safe travels!
text:
I love just about everything about this dealership with the exception of making a left out of the parking lot, but they don't control that, so five stars. This dealership is old school, got the good vending machines, the day's paper is up on the wall about the urinal, and most of them know A LOT about Fords. I worked with Julio, who was able to adapt his sales techniques to me, which is the mark of experience that a lot of folks are missing. As soons as he realized I hate high-pressure sales, he immediately just let me ask the questions and provided the answers. He presented the options for dealer add ons and then accepted my answer (I didn't have to repeat myself!).

Basically it was the type of experience where I now won't even bother going elsewhere, all my service appointments will be there, and if anyone asks if I know a guy, I will say, 'Yes, Julio will help you find the right fit as opposed to trying to make a sale." I'm not slamming pressure sales experiences, negotiation, etc. as those are very valid skills, my point is that they catered to the customer as opposed to thinking about the dollars and that has the counter-intuitive effect of making more dollars.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Erika Garcia
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Erika, we appreciate your honest review. We set a high standard for ourselves, so we are disappointed to hear that your experience with us was not a positive one. text:
Left my car there two weeks ago.  The day after Labor Day. Nothing's been done. No diagnosis, no courtesy call to tell me what's wrong. No update on any actions taken.

When I dropped it off the service tech tried to tell me that it takes a long time to work on my type of car. 2018 Lincoln MKZ Hybrid. And tried to mitigate by telling me he's had one in there since May. (I feel sorry for that guy).

Well I've had enough. I'm taking it to another dealer or shop where they actually fix cars. Not just store them.

responseFromOwnerText: Hi Irma, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Ford of Montebello! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!
text:
I came to Ford of Montebello after having a local mechanic change my brake pads, something went seriously wrong.   A few days after the check brake notice came on.  Of course, I was concerned so I took my car into Ford of Montebello to double check.  When I arrived, I was pleasantly greeted by Claudia Torres.  She was calm, professional and somehow settled my shaken nerves.  Claudia explained in detail step by step as my car was getting fixed the correct way!   It was an expensive fix, but well, worth it.   Thank you, Claudia, for taking the time to keep  me posted up until the shuttle picked me up to get my car back!
Everyone was very polite at Ford of Montebello
Also, a shout out to Steve Chen!  You guys are the best!!!
Claudia keep up your good work, treating people like they matter and are heard!
Best,
Irma Chavira
title: Ford of Montebello

text: I have been a Ford family customer since 1986 (the last 38 years) thru 2024 at this location (Ford of Montebello). name: Juan
responseFromOwnerText: Hello Juan, we can assure you that we do not find this type of behavior acceptable, and we'd like the opportunity to turn your experience around. Please reach out to our Service Director, Steven Chen at (323) 838-6920 at your earliest convenience to discuss how we can turn this experience into a positive one.
text: If you decide to bring in your vehicle to get serviced, expect it to be returned FILTHY. Oh boy.. I really expected better from this dealership. I brought in my vehicle for a recall this morning and didn't expect it to take all day. It didn't bother me that it took almost the entire day (8:30-5:00) what truly bothered me was the way my vehicle was returned to me. Not only did I catch the tech texting in my vehicle upon arrival, but the unpleasant smell left behind and the oily stains in my entire interior truly disgusted me. I honestly felt let down as I expected better from Ford of Montebello. The final straw that made me extremely angering was that the personal items in my center console were tampered with. I know exactly how I leave my items organized and they were messed with and left thrown in the center console. Management, please train your techs to do better and have the integrity when handling customer vehicles. It might not be a high end vehicle, but we break our backs with sweat and tears to have the luxury of having a vehicle. It was my first experience with service at Ford of Montebello and will most likely be my last.
title: Ford of Montebello

It's been two weeks and they are still going back and forth about something they promised but kept delaying on delivery.  I'm feeling like I'm being baited to give them a good rating on Ford Survey and Google.  - 7/16/2024 updated below was original survey sent in last week.

I had a specific car reserved before picking it up at the dealership. The Internet Sales Manager was very knowledgeable about the EV's technical aspects but had little time to share while I was there. The information provided was not current. I drove the car away with only 99 miles on the battery because the dealership has only one Level 2 charger.

Despite this, it is evident that the dealership cares about their customers. After contacting them to voice my frustration with the communication issues, they stepped up. They have a customer service liaison who effectively bridges the gap between pre-sales and after-sales service.

So I deleted my positive review because I never still received my second Key since the day I purchased my maverick back in January. I was told by Javier they would get me one. Still not have received a key. I've called it takes weeks or months to get a response. When they do respond they told me to bring my truck in to program the key. I'm 2hours away and they delivered my truck. Why should I spend a whole day round trip to get a new key they lost IT. I was told a manager would call me back NOTHING. The second key is in my contract which they are now breaching! This dealership has the worst communication AFTER the sale, of course they will response when they want to sell you something but good luck after!

STAY FAR AWAY! BUY AND SERVICE YOUR VEHICLE SOMEWHERE ELSE.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Erik
text: Recently bought two brand new suv's from them. i also got an extended warranty and a continued service program, realized, i dont really want/need it. I've tried to cancel my warranties for about a week now, knowing i can legally cancel ANYTIME. Yet the financial manager insists that I have to wait 90 days in order to cancel, also adding that its their policy. A day ago, I spoke to a different financial manager of Ford, and they let me know that she was lying to me, and telling me that i could cancel at any time....At this point I've been in person to cancel and been contacting the financial manger through emails and havent gotten any info back, or any update on the cancelation process. This is totally unprofessional  and disappointing, especially coming from a "president's award." Ford. Im going to have to take a different route in order to cancel these warranties to get the full amount of money back before it becomes a pro-rated amount. (either through the lenders or the warranty companies) because clearly this financial manager really wants her commission
title: Ford of Montebello

responseFromOwnerText: Hi Joseph, we are so disappointed to learn of this situation you have described. We would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you regarding this matter so we can work towards a resolution. Please contact Service Director, Steven Chen at (323) 838-6920 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to make this right.
text: After taking my 2022 Explorer ST back (and thats been afew times) well this time just for a oil change. It was kinda quick so I thought, so about 5 days later and only driving it about 50 miles I see a oily spot under my left rear. So I reach behind the rear tire/rim and pull out my hand and it was covered with thick grease that I know its CV joint grease. As since they did a tire rotation and a full inspection of my car (and oil change why didnt he see the thick grease all over my wheels and tires? He did a brake pad measurement and tire tread but didnt see the grease all over the front suspension area???? Hello! ya didnt see anything! I even said to myself to never go back to this dealer (this is my 4th car from them) but since they missed this problem I had to go back to them.

name: Guadalupe Nunez Gomez
text:
Compre una Bronco Sport 2021 y (fui primer dueño). Que me ha dado muchos problemas.  He tenido que estar yendo muchas veces y el carro no queda bien.  EL SERVICIO QUE HAN MOSTRADO NO ES DE EXCELENCIA.  Por ejemplo: En Marzo fui a revisar mi vehículo porque iba a ir a Big Bear con mi familia (incluyendo 3 bebés) y el técnico me dejó saber que estaba en buenas condiciones de repente un neumático se ponchó y pudimos ver que no tenía ni frenos.  Es una irresponsabilidad muy grande, pudimos haber tenido un evento muy desagradable. Pero después  que se pagó el cambio de frenos, aceptaron que si lo ocupaba. Ahora cada vez que da la reversa hace un rechinido. Hai mismo el caro no quiso prender y tuvieron que cambiar la batería. (Bueno es lo que dijieron)

Me han llegado cartas de advertencias acerca de algunas piezas que salieron defectuosas que necesitan ser reemplazadas.
Desde el año pasado, he visitado la agencia queriendo cambiar las piezas que están llamadas a ser reemplazadas por defecto de fabricación y al día de hoy no lo han hecho.

DESCEPCIONADA Y MUY FRUSTRADA DE QUE EL SERVICIO, LA GARANTÍA Y EL CONTROL DE CALIDAD QUE FORD DE MONTEBELLO PUDO OFRECERME ES MUY POBRE.
Pues al ir a la agencia todos se pasan la bolita y nadie se responsabiliza, ni siquiera de dar una informacion real o hablar con alguien que de respuestas y no excusas.

Nos hacen llamar a la agencia, nos transfieren con una persona llamada María.  Ella nos refiere con un asociado técnico y otra vez a comenzar el ciclo, todo esta bien, no hay piezas bla bla, bla bla. Llamen de nuevo.  DESCEPIONANTE  POR TRATARSE DE UNA AGENCIA RECONOCIDA.
textTranslated:
I bought a 2021 Bronco Sport and (I was the first owner). Which has given me a lot of problems.  I have had to go there many times and the car doesn't fit well.  THE SERVICE THEY HAVE SHOWN IS NOT EXCELLENT.  For example: In March I went to have my vehicle checked because I was going to Big Bear with my family (including 3 babies) and the technician let me know that it was in good condition, suddenly a tire went flat and we could see that it didn't even have brakes.  It is very irresponsible, we could have had a very unpleasant event. But after the brake replacement was paid for, they accepted that it would be used. Now every time you put it in reverse it makes a grinding noise. The car itself didn't want to turn on and they had to change the battery. (Well that's what they said)

I have received warning letters about some defective parts that need to be replaced.
Since last year, I have visited the agency wanting to change the parts that are due to be replaced due to manufacturing defects and to date they have not done so.

DISAPPOINTED AND VERY FRUSTRATED THAT THE SERVICE, WARRANTY AND QUALITY CONTROL THAT FORD OF MONTEBELLO WAS ABLE TO OFFER ME IS VERY POOR.
Well, when going to the agency everyone passes the buck and no one takes responsibility, not even for giving real information or talking to someone who gives answers and not excuses.

They make us call the agency, they transfer us to a person named María.  She refers us to a technical associate and again to start the cycle, everything is fine, no parts blah blah blah blah. Call again.  DISAPPOINTING BECAUSE IT IS A RECOGNIZED AGENCY.
title: Ford of Montebello

responseFromOwnerText: Hi Ivan, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Ford of Montebello! We hope you continue to choose Ford of Montebello for all your vehicle needs! Take care!
text:
Recently, my wife and I purchased a 2024 Ford Bronco (Badlands) from Montebello Ford. We made a last minute decision to visit the dealership at 8:30pm (half hour before closing) and were met with friendly and professional people. We knew it was late and felt a need to hurry, but were put at ease at the level of comfort they gave us in not hurrying!
Our salesman and along with the fleet, sales manager and finance all worked with us and met everyone of our needs when purchasing the vehicle. The whole entire process was very transparent, clear and to the point. To keep this short, we made and offer and were pleasantly met with an agreement and rolled out of there within a few hours with our dream Bronco!
Thank you again to those who were involved in the sale, we could'nt have asked for a better experience and if you are looking for your dream vehicle, there is no other Ford dealership that is going to match the professionalism and courtesy we received in Montebello.
Thanks again everyone!
title: Ford of Montebello

We brought our transit to get checked out on some noises it was making, being only 4 years with the truck we were concerned and hoping the premium care would cover something of what was going on but nope that premium care they sell u when u purchase the ford is a scam so don’t do it cus it’s expensive, we had to rent a work van cus we weren’t sure how long it’d take, Terry (?) first told us one week then doesn’t even call to give us updated we have to chase him down to get any updates, then tells us Wednesday  for sure (after already 2 weeks) then comes Wednesday no call or anything so I call ford premium cus I’m also Curious to see if they can help cover any expenses the guy there has been way more helpful and communicative, they had our truck for over 3 weeks and still tell us ok come get it today but be here at 545 cus we close at 6 we get there and still they’re not done!! name: Kelly Ballesteros
responseFromOwnerText: Hola Kelly, gracias por compartir tus comentarios honestos. Estamos decepcionados de que haya tenido una experiencia tan negativa al tratar con nosotros aquí en Ford of Montebello. Podemos asegurarle que realmente no fue nuestra intención decepcionarlo o frustrarlo durante este proceso. Tomamos en serio los comentarios de nuestros clientes, por lo que esperamos que llame a nuestro Gerente General, Jonivan Valles, al (323) 838-6920 para que podamos entender exactamente qué salió mal y hacer todo lo posible para tratar de resolver este asunto de la mejor manera posible. Nuestra habilidad.
text:
Compre un carro hace 6 meses , semi nuevo con el reporte limpio de 0 daños y 0 problemas. En estos dias de lluvia comenze a notar todo el techo mojado y goteando de los lados, lo lleve al dealer para que lo revisaran ya que lo habia comprado el mantenimiento por 3 años, al principio no quisieron tomar el carro para revision, luego que tenia que hacer una cita para dentro de un mes, pero el de servicio le dio una revisada y dijo que si es una tapadera que el seguro no lo cubre que ya no es problema de
Ford. Entramos con los de finanzas a preguntarles que se podia hacer ya que claramente el carro estaba defectuoso y el seguro que pague al principio no iba a cubrir nada, lo unico que dijeron fue un veremos que se puede hacer pero igual que no aseguraban que la garantia la iba a cubrir. Se pasaban la responsabilidad de un lado a otro sin dar una solucion optima que funcionara.
Tomaron una actitud de hacemos lo que se puede pero de todas maneras tiene que salir de su bolsillo. No les crean cuando les vendan carros con su garantia que le ponen muchas trabas sin alguna buena solucion de su parte.
textTranslated:
I bought a car 6 months ago, semi-new with a clean report of 0 damages and 0 problems. On these rainy days I began to notice the entire roof was wet and dripping from the sides, I took it to the dealer to have it checked since I had purchased maintenance for 3 years, at first they did not want to take the car for inspection, after it had I had to make an appointment in a month, but the service person gave it a review and said that if it is a cover that the insurance does not cover it, it is no longer a problem.
Ford. We went in with the finance people to ask them what could be done since clearly the car was defective and the insurance I paid at the beginning was not going to cover anything, the only thing they said was we'll see what can be done but just as they did not ensure that the guarantee I was going to cover it. They passed the responsibility from one side to the other without providing an optimal solution that would work.
They took an attitude of we do what we can but it has to come out of their pocket anyway. Don't believe them when they sell you cars with their warranty because they put a lot of obstacles in your way without any good solution on their part.
title: Ford of Montebello

text:
I recently had the pleasure of leasing the 2023 Ford Mustang Mach-E from Ford of Montebello, and I must say, the entire experience exceeded my expectations in every way possible.
First and foremost, the staff (specifically Nazar the Sales Manager and Steve the Sales Specialist) at Ford of Montebello are truly exceptional. The sales team was knowledgeable, friendly, and patient, ensuring I had all the information I needed to make an informed decision. When it came time to discuss financing and pricing, the finance team at Ford of Montebello demonstrated transparency and worked diligently to find a financing solution that fit my budget. Their professionalism and commitment to customer satisfaction made the entire process smooth and stress-free.If you're in the market for a new Ford vehicle, I wholeheartedly recommend visiting Ford of Montebello – they have certainly earned my trust and loyalty. Thank you, Ford of Montebello, for making my dream car a reality!
title: Ford of Montebello

text: I did not like the way that buying my 2012 Prius went. First of all we were forced to pay for a $1000 alarm system that supposedly the car already had installed and there was no way around it. I was told to go the next day to activate it, however when I went the paper said alarm installation. Also during the process of buying the car we ask multiple times what was the total price and they would not tell us until we got to sign the contract we noticed they had included a $4000 warranty that they did not mentioned until we asked why was the price in the contract was so inflated. They did remove this warranty but I just didn’t like the way it felt like they were trying to hide information from us. Finally the car supposedly had been service a month before and when we check the oil it barely had any and it was black showing they had not done an oil change but the light was not on.

name: Ashley Gil
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Ashley, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at Ford of Montebello! Please let us know if you have any additional questions about the services you received and thank you again for choosing Ford of Montebello!
text:
I recently had the pleasure of working with a fantastic car sales representative Steve Miranda, and I would like to share my positive experience with others. He took the time to understand my needs and provided excellent guidance throughout the entire car-buying process for the second time!

His extensive knowledge of the vehicles, including their features, performance, and pricing, was impressive. They patiently answered all of my questions and ensured that I had all the information I needed to make an informed decision. I never felt rushed or pressured to make a purchase, which made the experience all the more enjoyable.

What truly stood out to me was his genuine interest in finding the perfect car for me. He actively listened to my preferences and went above and beyond to help me find a vehicle that matched what I wanted. I was able to call and have my first car back in 2020 also ready for me to take home matching my budget.

I highly recommend this Ford dealership and get with Steve Miranda for your car needs! I am extremely satisfied with my purchase and the overall experience, thanks in large part to their outstanding assistance.
title: Ford of Montebello

text:
Sales rep argued with me over vehicle pricing.
(Steve Miranda) also was boasting his credit score was higher than mine lol. I don’t like to boast about what I have which is why I just laughed at it.

So here are some CAR BUYING TIPS !

Don’t go to a dealership without first getting numbers always call them and if you can’t get the pricing you want through text then go to the next dealership. Always go to AutoNation dealerships they won’t charge you the markup that this dealership will. (Everything is negotiable)

Always get approvals from your local credit union they typically have better rates.

Never tell them what payment you want always say to give you the best they can do. (If they can do a lower one and you give a high one they will always give you a higher one.)

If they give you the 4 square paper always negotiate every square at the end of the day all the numbers matter.

Don’t let them run your credit before having a price out the door with taxes and everything for a vehicle. (Don’t give them your credit score, they will say because it isn’t good enough they can’t negotiate the car but they can.)

Interest rates are negotiable too.

Always buy at the end of the month they’re desperate to hit goals for them to receive big incentives from the banks they work with.

If you’re selling a car go to car max. They will always give you more. If you decide to sell here take the quote CarMax gave you and have them match it. If they can’t go else where.

Lastly, shop around and get different pricing.
If you order a vehicle through ford there isn’t any markups just a destination fee, they will say it will take too long but they don’t even know. Good luck ! Remember to ask for thousands off of  the vehicle you’re buying ! It’s doable !
title: Ford of Montebello

name: casey Scane
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!!
I Bought a vehicle from Ford of Montebello.  They said car was certified and safety checked. Tire pressure sensor light came on very next day. Checked pressure, everything seemed fine. 4th day after purchasing this vehicle, I'm on a business trip out of town and tire literally explodes on the freeway in the fast lane.  When it exploded it blew off parts of wheel well, plastic pieces, detached back rear of bumper and bent the rim as I was trying to proceed off fwy to a safe location etc. Very scary to say the least. Called roadside assistance to put on spare and then immediately called dealership. They sent me to the internet sales Mgr, who then informed me that his Mgr was off but would forward all pics etc and get back to me. I took my car immediately the next day to have tire replaced and they confirmed and documented that the tire sensor was defective, each tire had a different reading of air pressure and they were unable to re-set the sensor.They confirmed that the tire that exploded was over inflated. 7 straight days of 1 returned call, countless emails w 1 response stating literally, "sorry for the delay but we're really swamped here"  After days of absolute frustration and anger for being utterly ignored, lied to regarding soeaking to someone in charge, I was told "oh manager is off today" etc , I emailed General Mgr. He had another Mgr call me to question me about the incident. After I explained the whole story, again, he literally says "so what do you want us to do for you?" I simply explained for my car to be thoroughly fixed because of the damage caused by the defective tire sensor. He said "let me get with General Mgr and I'll get back with you. 2 days later he calls me and says well, when you purchased the vehicle the service center certified it was thoroughly checked and was safe. .LIE. Service also installed a brand new tire sensor so it was new when you purchased LIE. I said, let me talk to the General Mgr, "oh he's on vacation. AGAIN, LIE. All this dealership has done is lie. They are THE MOST dishonest dealership I have ever dealt with and I have purchased many vehicles. They could clearly care less about their customers or reputation. They have ZERO integrity whatsoever. I so regret purchasing my vehicle from them and am now left to my insurance Company litigating for me and going after them because of their dishonest practices. On the day I purchased the vehicle, the salesman pulled tthe car up after being washed. I went outside, he handed me the keys and walked away. No walk-thru and that was that.I finished  THINK VERY CAREFULLY BEFORE PURCHASING A VEHICLE FROM THIS CROOKED DEALERSHIP!!! And it pains me to have to give 1 star to post this review. It should be negative 100 stars.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: P D
text:
I had my car serviced at Ford of Montebello (2747 Via Campo in Montebello, CA 90640) today, July 7, 2023, and I have numerous complaints. The service was extremely poor for the following reasons:

1) I made an appointment the previous week to bring my car in for an oil change and multi-point inspection at 11 a.m. on 7/7/2023. I dropped my car off promptly at 11. They were not done with my car until 5 hours later at 4 p.m. For a simple oil change and inspection, this should not have taken this long.

I also noticed that the appointment box was checked "no" on my customer receipt, and I was marked at a lower priority. How can this be when I scheduled my appointment the week before? When making an appointment, it should not take that long to get my car back for a simple oil change and routine inspection.

2) When paying at the cashier, I was told that there was an oil leak. Why didn't they call me up and tell me that while I was patiently waiting for my car at home? Now I'm nervous that something is wrong with my car.

3) Also when paying at the cashier, I didn't receive the multi-point inspection results sheet. I have no idea what the status is for my brakes, battery, tire treads, etc. Complete negligence. And that's not all...

4) I was the victim of racial slurs by the shuttle driver who was taking me back home after I dropped my car off. The driver was Mexican and had a female passenger in the car with me. They both referred to me as "gringo" when talking about who would be dropped off first. Maybe they didn't think that I know Spanish, but I absolutely do know quite a bit, and I do NOT tolerate that blatant racism towards me. According to Merriam-Webster's dictionary, the word "gringo" is marked as "often disparaging. A foreigner in Spain or Latin America especially when of English or American origin." Clearly, we are in AMERICA, and you do NOT call people like me a gringo. In California especially, white people are the targets of racism, and believe me when I say that I do NOT tolerate this! That old Mexican shuttle driver needs to be fired asap. ASAP!

5) When I requested to be picked up, there was over an hour delay. I was told that the driver "got a flat tire." Do you really think I believe that? I was then picked up by the same exact shuttle vehicle that took me back home. So why couldn't they send that same vehicle in the first place? I highly doubt that the first driver (IF there was even a first driver) got a flat tire.

For the above reasons and the terrible service that I received, along with the blatant racism directed towards me, I would like a full refund of the $139.79 that I paid. If I don't get that, then a dispute with my credit card company will be forthcoming.

Let me tell you that I certainly won't be coming here again. You should all believe the 1-star reviews on here, and please take them very seriously. I'll also guarantee you that the Alhambra Ford dealership (Bob Wondries) went out of business for exactly this piss-poor type of customer service. Ford of Montebello is extremely likely to be next.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: LILY SANDOVAL
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Liliana, we set high expectations for ourselves so it’s gratifying to hear you had a great experience with us. Please let us know if there is ever anything else we can do for you! Safe travels!
text:
The best Ford dealership around! About six months ago, we placed an order for our Mustang Mach-E GT through Steve Miranda. Both he and his sales manager, Nizar Abassi, went above and beyond to deliver exceptional service. They not only guided us through the process with confidence but also allowed us to customize our vehicle without requiring any form of deposit. Their friendly and professional approach truly set them apart from any other Ford dealership!

Upon the arrival of our vehicle, the ever-accommodating Steve Miranda kindly reached out to us, inviting us for a test drive and an opportunity to see the Mach-E prior to taking ownership. Following our delightful conversation with Steve, the amicable duo of Nizar Abassi and Javier Sandoval proposed that, given our exceptional credit, we should consider financing with School's First instead of Ford Motor Credit. What an absolutely fantastic idea that was! It truly did wonders in significantly to do so! And — We SAVED A LOT OF money. At this dealership, you'll find that customer care is truly a top priority, and the atmosphere exudes friendliness with a touch of formality.

Upon revisiting the dealership two days later to pick up our Mach-E after waiting for our approval letter, we experienced a seamless and efficient process. Javier and Steve truly exceeded our expectations by providing exceptional explanations and generously accommodating us. The waiting time was incredibly swift, making the experience even more delightful! Who gets the process done in less than 2 hours? They do!!!! Jeff, the finance manager, kindly provided us with reassurance regarding the Gap and extended warranty, without exerting any pressure to opt for them. We bought both of course! His approach was both pleasantly persuasive and slightly formal. My girlfriend and I loved him!

Steve truly excelled and exceeded our expectations in demonstrating the car's charging process, its remarkable features, and all the exciting aspects. His efforts are genuinely appreciated, and we couldn't be more delighted with his friendly and professional assistance. We would like to extend our heartfelt gratitude to him and all the individuals who have contributed to our wonderful experience. This dealership is truly exceptional! I would pick Ford of Montebello 100’s over.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Angela Salci
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Angela, thank you for taking the time to leave us your response to our staff's outstanding customer service! It means so much to us to have earned your trust in our business! We hope to see you again in the future! Take care!

name: Honest Review
responseFromOwnerText: Hi, we're disappointed to hear of the negative experience you had at our location. We would like the opportunity to try and regain your trust in our business and resolve this matter for you, if we still can. Please contact our General Manager, Jonivan Valles at (323) 838-6920 at your earliest convenience so we can work with you to make this better. We look forward to speaking with you soon. Take care.
text: Being equipped with a loan calculator, the sales manager thinks he's slick presenting false numbers, expecting you to automatically believe him when he walks in and gives a lengthy speech on how he's there to help; no, he's there to test your education and math skills. Why would you do business with liars, I understand that all dealers work with similar strategies, but this dealer was by far the most sadistic—purchase Price 36k 5.9 apr 700 for 72 months with a downpayment that covered the taxes and fees. I was going to end up paying 56k for a 35k truck.  Be very careful with these pirates.  Ps never go with the first three deals presented; walk away.  The art of a car salesman; is to calculate education to be able to charge the most for a vehicle.
title: Ford of Montebello

text:
Service appointment set for 2015 Ford Explorer for customer satisfaction campaign. One included a door panel replacement. I was informed the door panel replacement was cancelled and no longer available. I shared my disappointment with the service advisor, who indicated they can repair for a $260 charge. I declined as I felt Ford should take ownership and responsibility for this repair as the customer satisfaction campaign remained posted on the Ford website. Unfortunately, this was not considered and my request to have it replaced under the campaign was denied... Steve. so much for the "customer satisfaction" campaign.

Update: owner responded to my initial review. I tried to call the service director Mr Steven Chen twice and left voice mail messages and never received a reply. So much for helping me resolve my poor customer service experience.

responseFromOwnerText: Hi Black, we are so disappointed to learn of this situation you have described. Please give us a call Service Director, Steven Chen at (323) 838-6920 and we will do our best to make this better. We hope to hear from you soon.
text: I took my 2010 Ford Fusion in for recalls & repairs. The rep that assisted me was polite, his name is Diego. But I've had other bad experiences with other service reps at Ford of Montebello. If you get Miguel he likes to run CON games to get more money. Miguel had told me I had a leak in my Fusion and it was coming from my transmission. I took my car to a transmission specialist and he said nothing was wrong. This is why I don't like going to the dealerships. When I went to pay and pick up my car, they had the wrong last name on the paperwork. Then I waited 1/2 an hour to get my car as I saw other customers come & pay then leave in 5 minutes. When I received my Fusion my steering wheel was shredded and oil all over it. No great customer service. If others had great experiences that's awesome but I did not.
title: Ford of Montebello

They removed the floor mats and said that the truck didn’t have any but there where mats at the time of the test drive.

This is a poor representation of what a FORD dealer should be. We have been a 3 generation FORD family and have never been so poorly treated.

Sad to see that the FORD name smeared by Montebello Ford.

name: CL Angeles
text: I am really disappointed by the service of this place!  My car recalls it with a red light on the dashboard, ready to go. I also need to change the car's oil and check a few things… as usual.  (I have an appointment on 10/10/2002 at 9:00am) When I arrived, the staff picked up the car and they told me it would be done the next day.  I came back and took a break from work that day because I didn't have a car!  The next day I was told that around 3:00pm the car would be finished.  OK, I waited… but then they said it would be done in the next day because the item they ordered to replace the car didn't arrive in time!!  I lost another day of work!  I asked them to finish it for me by tomorrow, they agreed and made an appointment after 12:00 noon.  The next day, I called to ask about the condition of the car, but it was only scheduled for 4:00pm!  I arrived before 4:00pm and waited… more than 20 minutes passed and still not received the car!  I asked and was told that it would be over in about 10 minutes because they had to test the car again.  I waited longer than that…and finally it was time to pay for the car.  But when I thought it was done, I didn't expect to go out to wait for the car to come out, but it took more than 15 minutes for someone to bring the car back!  I rushed to work and was 2 and a half hours late!  I cannot accept the way this company works!
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Jackson McCullough
text:
Ford of Montebello was a place that made my dreams come true.

I ended up purchasing a Ford Bronco which was the car of my dreams.

The people there made me feel like I had become apart of a family.

Oscar was the one who sold me the vehicle.  He was very detailed, determined, and one of the most respectful young men that I have ever met.  He helped me to make my dreams come true.

Sam was an amazing manager and was running the ship perfectly.

I am so honored to be apart of the Ford Montebello family and have recommended this place to all of my friends and family if they are out looking for a new and or used car.

I cant wait to go back one day and purchase my next dream vehicle.

This was outright the best experience that I had when purchasing a car.

Sometimes people feel like they want to avoid car dealerships but that is not the case here.

What an amazing experience.
title: Ford of Montebello

text: The few times I had to use the service department, has not been a pleasant experience and the carefree attitude of the staff is a huge deterrent.  If you have a lease with them and you decide to keep the car. be aware.  They will impose an extended warranty on you that you probably do not need.  However if you want than you are good, but you do not have an option and you have to use their financing options and the will tell you that the finance company is the one imposing it.  Good luck if your stuck with them.

text:
Go somewhere else for maintenance they’ll charge you full price for half the work.
Dropped my car off for maintenance and they told me it would take 3 days. Two and a half weeks later I got my car back with only half of the issues fixed and new things not working properly. They called me every day and told me they weren’t able to get a tech to look at it and it would be done the next day, because of that I didn’t need a loaner car. So I had to take Lyfts for two and a half weeks. They said they’d compensate for that in the bill but never did.

name: Joseph Amato
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Joseph, we're happy to hear you had such a positive experience with our team! We try to provide all of our guests with a great atmosphere and world-class service that you can trust.
text:
UPDATE: Service Department should be shut down. They had my car for 2 weeks. Nothing was done but “updates on the software” which turned out to be false. Zero communication while my car was there. I left several messages with Diego. I literally had to go down to see what was being done on my car. Was told parts had to be ordered and they would call when they were in. Still nothing. Fine. However I was also told I would get an invoice of what was done on my vehicle as “it wasn’t ready” when I picked up my car. Still nothing. I’ve left messages for Irving the service manager without a call back and I left a message with Steve (?) the director of service without a call back. Extremely unprofessional and not how you run a business. I will be reaching out to Ford corporate and to the BBB.

Manny was super helpful with getting me what I wanted! He knew a lot about the cars and the follow up has been phenomenal! Small dealership with a lot of cars and friendly staff!

I had been looking for a truck for a few months finally saw that ford montebello had the truck that I wanted
I saw the sale price they had and went in to check it out.
When I arrived  I was greeted by a salesman told him what I was there for he took me to the truck. I loved it and made him an offer  and they excepted. I got a good deal. I was in an out within 2 hours. Thank you to everyone at ford had a great first time experience
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Eric Liu
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Eric, we are so disappointed to learn of this situation you have described. Please give a call to Service Director, Steven Chen at (323) 838-6920 if you’d like to discuss this matter further. Thank you again for your honest feedback and we look forward to hearing from you. Take care.
text: Bought my Mustang here in 2017. They called me in for a routine oil change. After my car smelling awfully like oil a few days later, I opened my hood and discovered that they forgot to screw the cap back on after the oil change. Oil spilled everywhere and I was inhaling the fumes for at least 3 days. I went to a different mechanic and got it fixed, the oil spill caused some damage. I called Ford of Montebello and they have been ignoring my request for a refund for 2 weeks now. Their service is one of the worst I’ve ever seen. Definitely never coming back here. Photo of gas spillage shown.
title: Ford of Montebello

The in house service was ok, some team members were very very polite and professional. My only negative comment is that I was lied to and kind of pushed into signing for a car that I had voiced concerns on. They weren’t completely honest and I wish I knew then what I know now.
At the end of the day purchasing was my decision but I might have not signed that exact day if I had all the information. I might have still gone back but when it was more convenient for me.
It was just not a fair situation in my experience but I am happy with the car itself.

text: If you’re trying to get your car serviced here don’t bother they go through your trunk without asking and leave a whole entire mess. I left my ford for an oil change on 2/7/22 the car was clean (I had washed it the day before vacuumed toy bags fully sanitized and ready for work) due to my job I work from home with my first client so I had my mom pick up my vehicle since I was working. My mom came and told me how the back was so messy and how the toys which are always supposed to be sanitized where thrown everywhere. My client enjoys playing jenga well that toy was all over the place. They serviced my car did what they had to do but didn’t call me to ask to go through my trunk. This is invasion of privacy and also due to the fact that I work with children and my toys were touched is what disappoints me the most. We are in the middle of the pandemic and these employees did not follow COVID protocol. My fully sanitized toys were thrown out everywhere. The pictures below show how my car was the night before and how I dropped it off and how they returned me my vehicle. I also called and left a voicemail but no one has returned my call. Call that unprofessional.

text: Without a doubt, Ford of Montebello is one of the best dealerships I have ever dealt with.   My experience has been excellent because they don't treat you just like an ordinary customer but rather as a family member.  They have answered all my phone calls, scheduled appointments when needed, and have made themselves available during times of emergency.   Steven Miranda has been wonderful!   He is willing to go above and beyond to help with anything as well as to answer any of my questions.  He is willing to pick up the phone at any time and day of the week.   He definitely has treated me as a family member, and for this, I'm profoundly thankful.   I highly recommend this place.   Thank you Ford of Montebello.

responseFromOwnerText: Inci, we are so disappointed to learn of this situation you have described. text: I have never been more disappointed,  I recently purchased a used car from them on black friday left with due bill agreement stating that they would replace the rear tires of my Jeep, almost a month has gone by , I keep calling and keep getting the runaround. Javier Lopez Finally told me to come in today 12/17/21 because they have received inventory and that he had confirmed with his inventory Manager Jim Ryan. As soon as I got there 8AM no one seem to know anything , after half an hour of waiting they figure it out and confirm that they have the tires and will be switching them, at 12:25 pm I texted Diana for an update to later receiving a text stating that  they had an issue with the tired and that they had the wrong size.  This should be so complicated, I also asked for a call from their Supervisor to express my awful experience till this moment no one has called nor is my vehicle ready and they do not have an ETA. This is unreal and unbelievable

name: LaQro Ker
responseFromOwnerText: Hi, thank you for taking the time to bring this negative experience to our attention. It is discouraging to hear that you had anything less than a stellar experience here at Ford of Montebello. Please contact Service Director, Jim Ryan at (323) 838-6920 at your convenience so that we can understand the details of your situation and attempt to resolve this issue. Thank you for taking the time to give us your honest feedback and we look forward to speaking with you.
text:
The sales department is pleasant experience, however the service department is way below expectations, it takes over 1 week just to determine whats the issue with the vehicle. I can not comprehend why does it take over 1 week just to plug in the vehicle  to the computer, then several days to get parts. If you questioning the repair lead time its seems like they are punishing you by making you wait even longer. They are not returning your call in a timely manner, they do not keep the promises to update customers about the vehicle status, some of the service guys giving you attitude. I purchased a new vehicle here and someone forget to update the computer for the oversized tires they installed on the vehicle therefor  all electronics are off the chart, gas consumption, speed which is the most important you could get tickets, this small issue takes weeks to fix along with a minor solenoid valve replacement, For service take your beloved ford to other dealership or wait weeks. Total disappointment.
Update:
I called Mr Ryan of course no  one picked up the phone left a voice msg I did not get a call back. This afternoon I got a phone call from the person was handling my vehicle Vehicle is done but is not done in (in 2 weeks they were capable to replace a faulty solenoid valve 4hrs job tops) Maybe;  let me amplify MYABE  Monday the other company can look at the speedometer issues.
So if you wanna pay your car-loan and have your vehicle sitting at Ford of  Montebello's  lot this is the place you need to take your vehicle for service. if you wanna have it fixed in a timely manner then take it somewhere else.
Incompetent lousy service along with customer service, bottom line very bad repair management.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Gonzalo Melendez
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Gonzalo , thank you for taking the time to leave us your response to our Staff's outstanding customer service! Thank you so much for being one of our valued guests and we look forward to your next visit! Safe travels!
text:
I called Ford of Motebello to purchase an F-150 they had in stock during the Labor Day weekend 0% financing special... They advertised stock #510573 for $48,320 on cars.com and on their own website. When a salesman made contact, the first offer was $5,000 higher then the advertised sales price. When I asked about the advertised sales price, he said the manager would only honor the price if I agreed to buy $1,885 in after market add ons... I believe this is gauging, and it may be illegal. I will call the DMV on Tuesday to make an inquiry and to make a report on shady sale practices from this dealership... I am glad that all this took place via text, this way I can show proof that they tried to take advantage of me over one sale... I tried to speak with a manager to resolve the issue, and he never called back... What I regret the most is that I have to give them at least one star on this review...

The day after I posted this review, I received a call from Javi to see if there would be anything he could do to help me purchase the truck, and to rectify the buying experience at his place of business... He honored the price, deleted the charges for the additional products, and was upfront with all the numbers... he apologized for the previous mishandling of my attempt to buy from them. When I arrived, Oscar was ready for me, and made sure all the paperwork was promptly prepared for my signatures. The finance manager walked me through the paperwork, and I was ready to go... At the end of the transaction, Oscar spoke with me about my review, and asked me to consider making an update. Thanks Oscar and Javi...
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Clayton Coleman
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Clayton, we're happy you found our staff to be so supportive during your experience here at Ford of Montebello. We understand it is a big decision where you purchase your car from and we are grateful to have been chosen! Thank you for your business and we look forward to your next visit! Safe travels!
text: I purchased my car in the beginning of the year late February, and this was by far one of the best experiences purchasing a car.  Typically, you wither feel pressured, or when you sit down to crunch numbers the anxiety of the unknown of new payment, insurance going up etc.. however here at Montebello Ford is the first time I didn’t feel pressured, they made me feel comfortable and excited about my purchase.  The entire staff team, from the beginning had a true genuine honesty about them from the test drive, to the time crunching numbers and the final paperwork.  I’m sending this late review because my first oil change is due, and the customer service I received and experience from the mobile app and online has been great, and I look forward to being a future and long term customer when it time to purchase another car.

name: Hugo Martinez
text: He llevado mis carros por un largo periodo de tiempo a este concesionario y recientemente Tuve una muy mala experiencia de servicio. Me hicieron esperar más de lo habitual y la señorita que me atendió me dijo un precio pero al llegar a la caja para mi sorpresa, los números no coincidían y me explicaron algo de un cargo extra por exceso de aceite, que yo no pedí ni autorizace. Después alguien mas salió a darme explicaciones pero con una actitud despectiva y arrogante. No creo prudente regresar ni recomendar este lugar. Ojalá pueda hacer algo respecto a estos inconvenientes.
textTranslated: I have taken my cars for a long period of time to this dealership and recently had a very bad service experience. They made me wait longer than usual and the lady who served me told me a price but when I got to the cash register, to my surprise, the numbers did not match and they explained to me something about an extra charge for excess oil, which I did not ask for or authorize. . Then someone else came out to explain to me but with a contemptuous and arrogant attitude. I don't think it would be wise to return or recommend this place. I hope I can do something about these inconveniences.
title: Ford of Montebello

name: Naga Ambarish Chigurala
text:
To start with, I would like to call this dealership the fraudofmontebello , not the fordofmontebello
In the course of buying a Nissan Kicks SR/SV model through the Costco program, I happened to visit this dealership
We received a quote for $18,225 from the referral program.
On our first visit to the dealership, they told us that there was a bug on their system and that they could get me $20,995 instead of $18,225 as indicated on Costco auto website.
After negotiations, We settled on a price $20,495
As I was speaking to my bank the next day about a car loan, the guys from the dealership contacted me and offered me the same rate as my bank
Sales guy has sent me several chats stating the same thing
I made call before going to the dealer ship in person second time, that we are all good with the agreed terms
I arrived at the dealer with my family second time to sign and get the car
This is where all the drama began, as they hid the person I was chatting with by saying that they could not trace out the exact person ever after showing them the number and the chats
The person I called said that since I was talking to a different sales person now, he was unable to assist me and hung up in a hurry.
Also, a new sales representative was introduced. he said every internet sales representative was on leave that day
I was thinking that they may have access to the agreed terms and did a final test drive
When I was about to sign the document, this new sales guy came up to me and told me that they had installed security devices and that they couldn't honor the agreed price. New price is $23,500.
C'mon guys, where is your listed price of $18,225 and where is  $23,500
Despite numerous conversations over the phone, in person, and online, why cannot you disclose the price upfront?
How come the price shows up only when the documents are signed?
While this is happening, they have numerous chats and the salesman comes in and out numerous times, claiming to speak to the manager
An additional twist is that now a woman enters this contest and says that $23,500 is the final price
She offered us 15% off on the unseen new devices as we were about to leave, showing that she was compassionate
When I went to the dealership with my kids, I believed them and thought we could go back in a new car. I had to use Uber to return to my house.
Why they can't be honest even during high demand for cars is beyond my comprehension
Even if you price the car high, I bet there are customers willing to buy, at least during this chip shortage time. I don't know why they're wasting their and customers time.
I would recommend that even though they claim to offer the best prices on any vehicle, do not purchase one from them as they are not trustworthy
title: Ford of Montebello

text:
Absolutely horrible experience they damaged the vehicle and said absolutely nothing until we found out Monday morning.

Our company took one of our newer F-350 utility trucks for an oil change and regular maintenance at 29k miles.

Whoever was working there 7/10/2021 either improperly tried to lift or the truck fell off of their lift. They tried to jack the vehicle up by the utility box which was much easier than trying to jack it properly from the frame.

Their machine tore through the bottom of the tool box, ripped two holes and completely bent the box out of shape to where the doors won’t even close. They may have stolen some of my more expensive tools as I cannot find them. Will double check before putting the blame on the dealership and the “techs”

Let’s see what they do to fix it, or if they try to snake themselves out of it. Please don’t do business with this dealership, they didn’t even have the decency to tell me they damaged the vehicle.

Disgusting

text: I got to say it was very unfortunate ford of Montebello couldn't make a deal with me these last couple of months. I was in the market to renew my lease and we couldn't make it happen, in 2017 I could say wow Ford of Montebello took care of me like family and would reccomend them to everyone.  Considering I was a returning customer they mislead me trying to renew my lease saying I couldn't get approval anywhere for a lease within the Ford Family no matter the city I went to or dealership. Although we came close to getting a deal done a week ago with a payment agreed and the whole if we can make this happen today agree to this sign here and let's make it happen, I signed and everything and they took my payment for down payment they returned and said this couldn't happen. "That I had to purchase" and that was my only option. So disappointed being a returning customer they would lie to me but let me tell you all God is good they didn't deserve the sale or my business only looking out for themselves, I happened to go to Norm Reeves Ford in cerritos and they gave me an unbelievable deal at a cheaper payment than we ever got close to with Ford of Montebello for my 2020 Explorer with no hassle. I guess they only care about new customers and not returning customers. Or just about the comission totally understanding it's your job at some point I would say be considerate and think about the people in these times we're going through also and actually be helpful, be transparent don't ever mislead someone. People really consider your options before working with them.

text: The staff was very friendly at Ford of Montebello.  This dealership has very good manners and excellent training.  Every one was nice and said hi. Miguel helped take care of my purchase and made sure I got a good deal and everything I wanted while explaining the terms of the sale in a thorough manner.  Before I left they even cleaned the truck, put gas in it and followed me to my home as I did not have another driver with me.  I would leave 10 stars though I can only leave 5. :) Well done to the owners, management and the entire team for making me feel seen confirming I had found the correct place to purchase a truck for my company.

name: Kitty Cay
responseFromOwnerText: Hi Karla, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We set high expectations for ourselves so it's gratifying to see that you had such a positive car shopping experience with Josue, Enrique, and Jeff. Your recommendation means so much to us and we're happy to have earned it! Please let us know if we can be of any further assistance. Safe travels, and enjoy your new car!
text:
Came to this dealer for my first car and my second one. I had a good deal for the first one, but then I got a really great trade-in deal for my second one thanks to the help of two excellent salesmen- Josue and Enrique. They helped me obtain a car loan that covered my *new* car AND got rid of a personal loan that was killing me in interest. Now, my Fusion SEL 2019 (a techy car indeed) is financed at a MUCH lower interest rate at less than 1%, with excellent features that I am at ease with, including extended warranty and GAP insurance. I couldn't have possible gotten a better deal elsewhere!!

And not to forget- shoutout to the Finances guy- Jeff! He was very patient and thorough explaining all the information I needed to know with the new contract and addressed any questions I had.

But in short, I am very pleased with this Ford and with the help I received from its associates! :)
Totally recommend!!

responseFromOwnerText: Robert, our Staff works hard to go the extra-mile for our valued guests! We understand it is a big decision where you purchase your car from and we are grateful to have been chosen! Thank you again for your business and we look forward to your next visit! Safe travels!
text:
I had my easiest car purchase - EVER!
I called to talk to someone about a used car I saw on their website. I was quickly connected with Alejandro and we worked out the purchase price via text (which was my preference). Alejandro was professional and very responsive. He was not going to be working later that evening when I wanted to go in and finalize all of the paperwork, so he set me up with Danny, who did an excellent job. The car was exactly as described! I was offered additional items but never pressured, and got the deal I expected. The finance manager, Jeff, was equally curteous and efficient, not pressuring me for extras but allowing me to choose the things that fit my needs. After the purchase, Danny filled up the tank and I was on my way.
I am surprised to see the overall three star rating - my experience was 5-STARS!!!
THANK YOU, FORD OF MONTEBELLO!!!
